reviews.text: Nice new hotel. Standard Hampton Inn facility and service, very friendly staffs throughout the hotel. Very comfortable beds. Breakfast was great. They served fresh fruit in Fairbanks!!! The hotel is across from mega shopping plaza, Walmart, Fred Myer, sporting goods store, etc. Walmart and Fred Myer both are super center with grocery and souvenirs. It’s also close to downtown. Great location.
reviews.title: Very nice new hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. We were only there over night but couldn't have been more satisfied. The staff was friendly, the room beautiful and the continental breakfast great.
reviews.title: Absolutely awesome hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since my husband travels extensively and stays at Marriotts we usually use points to stay but the Springhill Suites couldn't accommodate us so we chose the Hampton and loved it enough that I want my husband to start staying with the Hilton chain. The location was much nicer and the accommodations nicer - even the breakfast! Just make sure you know where it's located as our GPS couldn't locate it and it's not on any of the maps since it's so new!
reviews.title: wish we could have stayed longer!

reviews.text: We stayed here for five nights as part of our trip to see the Aurora. The hotel is right off a main highway in the northern part of the city, but since Fairbanks isn't that large, it's still easy to drive to any place you'd like to go. The hotel is fairly new and everything is well maintained. The breakfast offerings vary each day with different types of eggs and meat offered. Our room was one of the accessible ones and it was spacious; the tub had five different safety bars and my mom felt very safe there. The room was quiet and restful, the beds and pillows most comfortable! The desk had multiple plugs that were easy to reach that allowed us to keep our electronics charged. The free wifi was very reliable. The room also had a fridge, microwave and coffee maker--all of which came in handy. There was a large shopping center across the highway that contained Walmart (which had a food department) and restaurants. There were two sets of washers and dryers (a dollar for each, plus a dollar to buy the soap from the front desk.) I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Comfortable, stress free.
Comfy new construction, kind staff
reviews.text: I often travel to Fairbanks on business and this was my first stay at the new Hampton Inn. I'll book here next time for sure. Everything is new, in good shape and contemporary style, with friendly staff at all hours. The breakfast area is big with a decent selection of food. During the day you can also grab a coffee or an apple. The location is close to restaurants and big box stores. The room has everything you need: beds, desk, fridge and microwave, nice TV, and comfy chair with foot stool. The bathroom is modern and well-appointed. Hiding behind the floor-to-ceiling mirror is the closet.

This is the 3rd time I come here this month (travel for work) and each time, I have not been disappointed. The front desk gals are very friendly, genuine, and kind. The morning crew for breakfast are also great - they offered me food eventhough I got to breakfast late and it was closed. Parking is easy and FREE and plentiful, it is close to all the shopping (Sportsmans, Petco, Lowe's, Walmart, B&N, etc) and major highway... there is also an indoor pool and hot tub (which is awesome). Now to the rooms - it's brand new, so they look great - everything has always been clean and orderly... beds are so comfortable and the whole place is top notch. oh yeah and free wifi and a nice huge screen TV (LCD, I think).
reviews.title: I would continue giving them business - they go above & beyond

reviews.text: we recently were traveling through alaska with friends, originally we had booked a b&b in fairbanks on the advise of reviews i had read just about every websight(trip advisor also) well not sure what happened but it turned out to be a bad experience for us, so we decieded to leave a day early and check into a hotel for our last night in fairbanks, we had driven by the hampton inn and we have stayed in a hampton inn before, so in the mnorning after breakfast at the b&b we moved into the hampton inn, the people at the desk were so friendly and helpful, they showed more hospitality and personality than the owner of the b&b, we went on a late night flight and returned to the hotel at 1 am and they had fresh baked cookies waiting for us, how cool is that:), the rooms were clean, modern,comfortable with a wonderful large walk in shower, the breakfast was typical but they had fruit, cookies, coffee, tea available at all times, wish we had booked with them in the first place
reviews.title: don't pass this one up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is quite new and the fixtures and fittings are very well done. You are no real distance from the airport, or for that matter, the train station but it is on the main road through Fairbanks and every night, all night, the trucks run through. This is probably not a problem if you are at the back of the hotel, but we weren't! The rooms are very big and very well appointed with a small kitchenette and a super king size bed. The breakfast is very good and you can help yourself to anything you want which includes eggs, waffles, muffins, bacon etc. I would recommend it as a hotel but do ask for a rear room.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel and rooms, shame about the area and noise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both my wife and I were extremely impressed with the overall quality, service and value during our one night stay at the Hampton Inn at Fairbanks. We've stayed at more pricey and hip hotels that didn't deliver in any of those areas so I feel really compeled to give this Hampton a five star rating.
reviews.title: Great, comfortable hotel at a reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highlights: Pool, gym, continental breakfast, empty refrigerator, plug in outlets in the parking lot, lots of TV channels, FREE Internet (rare at Hilton hotels), a business center (great for printing your boarding pass), comfortable bed, and close proximity to Fred Meyer (to pick up that bottle of vino for a romantic evening).
reviews.title: Best in class, one of newest properties in Fairbanks

reviews.text: Lowlights: We didn't have any bath towels in our room upon check in but that was quickly fixed by the friendly person at the front desk.
reviews.title: Once I found the place - I really liked it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK, it is a Hampton Inn. It is not fair to compare thus hotel to "more local" options. With that said, the hotel is best in it's class. The rooms are spacious and very nicely decorated. Public areas are spotless and spacious. Breakfast is standard Hampton Inn fare.
reviews.title: Outstanding value, greatly exceeded expectations!
